intro: Clusia troncosii, commonly known as the trunked clusia, is a striking evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its thick, often swollen trunk and glossy, dark green leaves that are typically opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually yellow or white, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Clusia troncosii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to tolerate various environmental conditions.
